abstract: Add functionality to an existing type.
overview:
The Swift Programming Language (6.2.1)  Extensions  Extensions ExtensionsAdd functionality to an existing type.Extensions add new functionality to an existing class, structure, enumeration, or protocol type. This includes the ability to extend types for which you don’t have access to the original source code (known as retroactive modeling). Extensions are similar to categories in Objective-C. (Unlike Objective-C categories, Swift extensions don’t have names.)

Extensions in Swift can:

Add computed instance properties and computed type properties
title: Extensions | Documentation
